7.1.1 - Imported Basecourse Materials Source Property Testing - Crushing Resistance
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY - NZTA M/4 Crushing Resistance (CR130) Test
METHODS OR REFERENCE - NZS 4407 Test 3.10, NZTA M/4
FREQUENCY - 1 test per 10,000 m3 of source material per source, or when a variation occurs in the rock geology e.g. new seam of rock
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Crushing resistance must reach 130 kN with less than 10% fines passing 2.36mm sieve
DESCRIPTION - Hold Point – All source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road for a source <2 years old
RECORDS / REMARKS - All source aggregate test results to be submitted to NZTA for review and verification
7.1.2 - Imported Basecourse Materials Source Property Testing - Weathering Quality
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY - Weathering Quality Index (WQI) Test
METHODS OR REFERENCE - NZS 4407 Test 3.11, NZTA M/4
FREQUENCY - 1 test per 10,000 m3 of source material per source, or when a variation occurs in the rock geology e.g. new seam of rock
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Must have quality index of AA, AB, AC, BA, BB or CA
DESCRIPTION - Hold Point – All source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road for a source <2 years old
RECORDS / REMARKS - All source aggregate test results to be submitted to NZTA for review and verification
7.1.3 - Imported Basecourse Materials Source Property Testing - Bearing Strength
METHODS OR REFERENCE - NZS 4407 T3.15, NZS 4402 T4.1.3, NZTA M/4
FREQUENCY - 1 test per 10,000 m3 of source material per source, or when a variation occurs in the rock geology e.g. new seam of rock
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Soaked CBR ≥ 80% when compacted/tested in accordance with both tests
DESCRIPTION - Hold Point – All source testing results to be provided prior to placement of material on road for a source <2 years old
RECORDS / REMARKS - All source aggregate test results to be submitted to NZTA for review and verification

RECORDS / REMARKS - All production aggregate test results to be submitted to NZTA for review and verification
